Bos Baru Bank Mandiri Diminta Tingkatkan Modal, Ini Sebabnya
02 Nov 2019, 07:57 by Caesar Akbar, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pengamat perbankan Indonesia Banking School (IBS) Batara Simatupang mengatakan setidaknya ada dua pekerjaan rumah yang mesti diselesaikan oleh Direktur Utama Bank Mandiri yang baru nantinya. Saat ini posisi orang nomor 1 di perusahaan perbankan pelat merah itu belum terisi, setelah ditunjuknya Kartika Wirjoatmodjo sebagai Wakil Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara di Kabinet Indonesia Maju Periode 2019 - 2024.
Pekerjaan rumah itu antara lain meningkatkan modal untuk memperbesar modal Bank Mandiri. "Juga secara cepat membebaskan Bank Mandiri dari perangkap NPL (non performing loan) dan persoalan hukum yang belum selesai," ujar Batara dalam pesan singkat kepada Tempo, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Berdasarkan laporan kinerja Bank Mandiri triwulan III 2019, tercatat pertumbuhan rata-rata Kredit Konsolidasi yang mencapai 11,5 persen year-on-year atau mencapai Rp 806,8 triliun pada September 2019.
Pertumbuhan kredit tersebut dibarengi dengan perbaikan kualitas. Rasio NPL atau kredit macet gross turun 48 basis poin menjadi hanya 2,53 persen dibandingkan September tahun lalu. Perbaikan ini membuat Bank Mandiri dapat menurunkan biaya CKPN alias Cadangan Kerugian Penurunan Laba sebesar 6,27 persen.
Di samping itu, Batara melihat kinerja Bank Mandiri cukup baik. Catatannya, rasio modal minimal bank masih sangat besar yaitu di angka 22,5 persen. Ia mengingatkan bahwa CAR besar bukan berarti label baik. "CAR adalah ukuran produktifitas, jadi sebaiknya Bank Mandiri melakukan ekspansi kredit dengan menjaga kisaran CAR 16 persen," tutur Batara.
Dengan demikian, kata Batara, ROA (return on asset), ROE (return on equity) dan BOPO (Biaya Operasional Pendapatan Operasional) akan meningkat. Ke depannya, ia juga mendorong Bank Mandiri mengembangkan layanan OMNI channel secara terintegrasi hal ini untuk menghadapi tuntutan pelanggan yang semakin marak di akuisisi oleh Fintech Startup Company.
Dengan tuntutan seperti itu, Batara mengatakan kriteria utama Direktur Utama Mandiri adalah kandidat berasal dari bank pengelola buku 4, bahkan sebaiknya dari dalam. Sehingga, kandidat memahami dengan benar dan mendalam mengenai anatomi Bank Mandiri.

Bank Mandiri's New Boss Asked To Increase Capital, This Is The Reason
02 Nov 2019, 07:57 by Caesar Akbar, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Banking School (IBS) banking observer Batara Simatupang said there are at least two homeworks to be completed by the new President Director of Bank Mandiri. At present the position of the number 1 person in the state-owned banking company has not been filled, after the appointment of Kartika Wirjoatmodjo as Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises in the Advanced Cabinet of the 2019-2024 Period.
The homework includes raising capital to increase Bank Mandiri's capital. "It also quickly freed Bank Mandiri from the trap of NPL (non-performing loans) and unresolved legal issues," Batara said in a short message to Tempo, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Based on Bank Mandiri's performance report for the third quarter of 2019, the average Consolidated Credit growth was recorded at 11.5 percent year-on-year or reaching Rp 806.8 trillion in September 2019.
Credit growth was accompanied by improvements in quality. The gross NPL ratio or non-performing loans fell 48 basis points to only 2.53 percent compared to September last year. This improvement allows Bank Mandiri to reduce the cost of CKPN aka Allowance for Loss of Profit Reduction by 6.27 percent.
In addition, Batara saw that Bank Mandiri's performance was quite good. Note, the minimum capital ratio of banks is still very large at 22.5 percent. He warned that a large CAR does not mean a good label. "CAR is a measure of productivity, so Bank Mandiri should expand credit by maintaining a CAR range of 16 percent," Batara said.
Thus, said Batara, ROA (return on assets), ROE (return on equity) and BOPO (Operational Costs for Operating Income) will increase. In the future, he will also encourage Bank Mandiri to develop OMNI channel services in an integrated way to meet the demands of customers that are increasingly widespread in acquisitions by Fintech Startup Company.
With such demands, Batara said the main criteria for the Mandiri President Director were candidates from the bank managing book 4, and even from within. Thus, candidates understand correctly and deeply about the anatomy of Bank Mandiri.
